Analysis of binned data¶

Binned data - analysis of HiC, binned to resolution.

class binnedData.binnedData(resolution, genome)¶

base class to work with binned data

Methods

Sets up the Genome object and resolution.

Parameters :

resolution : int

Resolution of all datasets

genome : genome Folder or Genome object

Methods

initChromosomes()¶

loads mappings from the genome class based on resolution

simpleLoad(filename, name, checkGenomes=True)¶

load standard type data

loadGC()¶

loads GC content at given resolution

removeDiagonal(m)¶

does what it says from all datasets

removeStandalone(offset=3)¶

removes standalone bins (groups of less-than-offset-long bins)

Parameters :

offset : int

Maximum length of group of bins to be removed
removePoorRegions(names=None, cutoff=2)¶

removes cutoff persent of bins with least counts

trunkTrans(high=0.0005)¶

trunkates trans contacts to remove blowouts

removeCis()¶

sets to zero all cis contacts

fakeCisOnce(extraMask=None)¶

used to fake cis counts. If extra mask is supplied, it also fakes stuff in the extra mask

fakeCis()¶

fakes cis contacts in an interative way

emulateCis()¶

if you want to have fun creating syntetic data, this emulates cis contacts. adjust cis/trans ratio in the code

fakeMissing(stay=False)¶

fakes missing megabases

correct(names=None)¶

performs single correction without SS

iterativeCorrectWithoutSS(names=None, M=50)¶

performs iterative correction wihtout SS

iterativeCorrectWithSS(names=None, M=55)¶

performs iterative correction with SS

iterativeCorrectByTrans(names=None)¶

performs iterative correction by trans data only, corrects cis also

removeZeros()¶

removes bins with zero counts keeps chromosome starts, ends, etc. consistent

restoreZeros(value=nan)¶

Restores zeros that were removed by removeZeros command.

Warning

You can restore zeros only if you used removeZeros once.

doPCA()¶

performs PCA on the data creates dictionary self.PCA with results

doEig()¶

performs eigenvector expansion on the data creates dictionary self.EIG with results

cisToTrans(mode='All', filename='GM-all')¶

Calculates cis-to-trans ratio. “All” - treating SS as trans reads “Dummy” - fake SS reads proportional to cis reads with the same total sum “Matrix” - use heatmap only

class binnedData.binnedDataAnalysis(resolution, genome)¶

Class containing experimental features and data analysis scripts

Methods

Sets up the Genome object and resolution.

Parameters :

resolution : int

Resolution of all datasets

genome : genome Folder or Genome object

Methods

plotScaling(name, label='BLA', color=None)¶

plots scaling of a heatmap,treating arms separately

averageTransMap(name='GM-all', mycmap='hot_r', chromMax=22, vmin=None, vmax=None)¶

plots and returns average inter-chromosomal inter-arm map

perArmCorrelation(data1, data2, doByArms=[])¶

does inter-chromosomal spearman correlation of two vectors for each chromosomes separately. Averages over chromosomes with weight of chromosomal length For chromosomes in “doByArms” treats arms as separatre chromosomes returns average Spearman r correlation

divideOutAveragesPerChromosome()¶

divides each interchromosomal map by it’s mean value

interchromosomalValues(filename='GM-all', returnAll=False)¶

returns average inter-chromosome-interaction values, ordered always the same way

Fragment-level HiC correction
